data.title: Tech giants face new scrutiny causing stocks to recoil
data.text: Tech stocks short-circuited Monday on reports that Silicon Valley’s top companies are facing unprecedented scrutiny of their business practices by government regulators perusing anti-competitive practices. Google parent company Alphabet and Facebook both tumbled more than 6 percent, and Amazon dropped close to 5 percent on reports that the Justice Department and Federal Trade Commission are.

data.title: Apple touts privacy in web sign-on war with Facebook, Google
data.text: Apple Inc on Monday launched a "Sign In With Apple" function to rival Facebook and Google web login accounts, drawing a contrast with rivals by stressing protection of users' information.

data.title: Is this the beginning of the end for big tech as we know it?
data.text: The war on big tech. Alphabet sinks into a bear market. With CNBC's Eamon Javers and Melissa Lee, and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Brian Kelly, Dan Nathan and Guy Adami.

data.title: Apple took several swipes at Google and Facebook at its biggest software event of the year
data.text: The launch of Apple's sign-in software underscores its multi-year effort to organize its marketing and engineering efforts around privacy.

data.title: Dow Jones Futures: Stock Market Correction Intensifies On Facebook, Google, Amazon — But This Is The Worst Part
data.text: Stock futures: The market correction intensified as antitrust-probe fears hit Facebook, Google, Amazon and Apple. Worse, top software stocks from Adobe to Twilio sold off.

data.title: Alphabet shares slide 6% on possible DoJ antitrust probe
data.text: Alphabet Inc's shares closed 6% down on Monday following reports that the U.S. Justice Department may investigate Google for hampering competition.

data.title: GOOGL, AMZN & FB Stock Fall as Antitrust Investigations Hit Silicon Valley, Again
data.text: Alphabet Inc., and Amazon.com Inc. stocks opened Monday down big, with Amazon down 3% and Google down over 6%.

data.title: Nasdaq confirms correction as Facebook, Alphabet, Amazon drag
data.text: The Nasdaq tumbled 1.6% on Monday, confirming a correction as it was dragged down by Alphabet, Facebook and Amazon.com on fears the companies are the targets of U.S. government antitrust regulators.

data.title: U.S. probe of Google's online ad dominance would appease long suffering rivals, publishers
data.text: Ad tech firms and publishers have had to stay in the good graces of Google or risk insolvency.

data.title: Why Facebook, Alphabet, and Centene Slumped Today
data.text: Tech stocks generally underperformed their peers on a rough day on Wall Street.
